results.title: Software Developer
results.description:
We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for a Software¬†Developer - Managed Cloud Applications.

Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud.¬†

¬†

Your daily work:

  • Working during business hours on systems that are built by Nordcloud and in production
  • Optimizing and evolving them and resolving issues
  • Internally collaborating with software architects, developers, and other professionals working on the systems¬†
  • Supporting and assisting other developers, cloud architects, and administrators
  • Building long-term relationships with our customers

¬†

Your skills and attributes of success:

  • Tech skills & experience with web technologies (Html, CSS, etc.) as well as Node.js, Typescript¬†and Git
  • Experience in working on public cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP)¬†
  • Beneficial would be experience with React and/or serverless solutions
  • Appreciation for code that is easily read by humans and efficiently executed by machines
  • Strong motivation, capabilities to learn new and passion to grow to the next level
  • Fluent communication skills in¬†English¬†

¬†

What do we offer in return?

  • A highly skilled multinational team
  • Individual¬†training budget¬†and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, GCP) and additional¬†certification bonus¬†covered by Nordcloud
  • Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a¬†community¬†of leading cloud professionals
  • Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
  • Freedom to work fully¬†remotely¬†within Finland
  • Benefit¬†packages attached to country of residence

Please read our¬†Recruitment Privacy Policy¬†before applying. All applicants must have the¬†right to work in Finland.¬†

If you'd like to join us,¬†please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile.

About Nordcloud¬†

Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It's a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Amazon Web Services ‚Äì and is a Visionary in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and it has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects.

Learn more at¬†nordcloud.com

#LI-Remote

results.title: Senior Software Engineer
results.description:
Haul is a digital hiring platform that connects certified and vetted commercial truck drivers with trucking companies in a flexible and efficient manner. Haul provides drivers the freedom to choose assignments based on type, length, and schedule, while offering visibility to pay and immediate access to earned wages.
¬†
Simultaneously, Haul meets the needs of third-party logistics, private fleets, and trucking companies to provide drivers in a way that best meets their business needs, from temporary flex workers to full-time hires. Created by Uber Freight alumni, Haul is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and Denver.
¬†
Our stack:
- Microservices
- NestJS (NodeJS + TypeScript)
- ReactJS + ReactNative
- MongoDB
¬†
Why this would be an exciting opportunity for you:
- We're a small team - you'll be one of our first engineering hires.
- Your work will move the needle.
- We're not just another software company. We're building solutions to solve real-world problems, creating employment opportunities for one of the most underserved demographics in America.
- You won't be just coding all day. You will be part of operations - understand various aspects of the business. We believe in a well-rounded engineer.
- We have a roadmap to build many industry-first features. The technical challenges are abundant if you're looking for them.
¬†
Why this might NOT be a good fit for you:
- If you're looking for a first job out of boot camp. Our team is small and we are building a more experienced team to execute. We don't have the luxury of resources at the moment to train someone new to Node.JS or React.
- We're a small team. We don't have everything figured out. Don't expect to have a process for everything you do or are asked to do.
- Things change quickly in startup work. We do our best to plan our work but things can change. If you're not a fan of being flexible and adaptive, this might not be for you.
- Fast-paced, take a risk.
- We won't ask you to write code that lasts forever. We will ask you to architect and build things that can accommodate changes 6-12 months down the road.
- Self-driven / most of the time, you'll be remote. We have an office in the Bay Area but most of our staff are remote.
Benefits & Perks
üìà Stock options and competitive compensation package
üèù Flexible personal time off
ü©∫ Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
üè¶ Employer-sponsored 401k
¬†
For an all-remote position in the rest of the United States, we're putting a lot of thought into building an all-inclusive remote environment. Prioritizing documentation over verbal communication, asynchronous vs. in person.
¬†
#LI-REMOTE

results.title: Senior WordPress Engineer
results.description:
Let‚Äôs work together to solve interesting engineering challenges for large enterprises across the globe using WordPress. We deliver secure and scalable WordPress solutions for Fortune 500 companies, government agencies, and publicly listed companies all over the world.

Responsibilities
  1. Deliver secure, scalable, and easy to maintain WordPress solutions using engineering best practices and relevant coding standards.
  2. Write test cases for all the code you develop.
  3. Write and maintain technical project documentation including inline code commenting, Git repo readme, and clear commit messages.
  4. Respect timelines and communicate progress proactively. We are a remote team, so proactive communication is very important.
  5. Help other engineers on the team through architectural reviews, code reviews, and other peer reviews.
Must Haves
  1. In-depth WordPress engineering experience with high-quality outcomes.
  2. A decent understanding of¬†HTML, CSS, and plain JavaScript.
  3. Good understanding of¬†computer science fundamentals.
  4. Comfortable with¬†git-based development and deployment workflow.
Good to Have (Optional)

Some experience with the following:

  1. WordPress VIP platform
  2. Gutenberg block development¬†
  3. WordPress REST API/GraphQL


Work on challenging projects for some of these folks!

results.title: Engineering Team Lead
results.description:
About Covidence

Our mission is to dramatically improve lives by changing the way the world creates and uses knowledge.

Launched in 2014 Covidence is a world leading SAAS platform that enables health and science research teams to rapidly synthesize and uncover actionable insights from the mountains research produced around the world. We do this by accelerating a research workflow called ‚Äòsystematic review,' the gold standard for synthesizing research evidence. Many of the world's most prestigious and innovative universities and hospitals are Covidence subscribers.

We are embarking on a new phase of growth which will see our product offering expanding and our engineering team significantly growing.

The perks and benefits

  • Great salary: we pay competitively and review salaries regularly
  • 100% remote: live and work where you choose whilst ensuring a 6 hour crossover with the AEST 9AM-5PM work day
  • 5 weeks paid leave: 4 weeks standard plus a bonus week at Christmas, a day off for your birthday and the option to purchase 3 more weeks pro rata
  • Flexible start date: want to take a holiday first? Let us know what your preferred start date is.
  • Knowledge allowance: so you keep learning and developing,
  • Impact: by working here you will have more impact on humanity than an individual scientist
  • Monthly home allowance to set up and run your home office

The opportunity

Covidence is seeking an Engineering Team Lead to join our Product & Engineering team, reporting to our Head of Engineering.¬†

This is a newly created role and level. In the past 12 months we've grown the engineering team from 3 to 9 members and we will continue to scale the team over the coming years.

We're keen to chat to candidates from all levels of management experience to learn about the talents you can bring to our team. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves to make a difference; a self-starter who pitches in and embodies our values: One team, Find a way and Honour Knowledge.

You'll get to

  • Manage a team of 4+ mid/senior engineers and drive their career growth paths
  • Partner with product managers, designers and customer support so that the right feedback loops are in place to discover and deliver valuable, usable, and buildable outcomes
  • Hire and onboard new team members as we grow
  • Support your team to deliver high-quality software¬†
  • Ensure we make architecturally-sound engineering decisions
  • Drive engineering best practices like code review and pair programming
  • Refine the team's processes to improve development, quality assurance, and delivery
  • Use modern tools of the trade - Macbook Pro, Slack, Zoom, GSuite, Miro, Confluence and Figma

What you bring:

  • Experience and great passion in leading or mentoring software engineers
  • Advocate of DevOps/SRE culture
  • Great communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Experience in architecting scalable Ruby on Rails applications
  • A keen interest in modern technologies such as React and PostgreSQL
  • A reasoned and pragmatic approach to software development and testing
  • A love of problem-solving
  • Experience working in an agile development environment
  • Interest in data and ML for future growth

Our platform

We build new features to support our vision and at the same time modernise our technology for scale. Here's a summary of our tech stack:

  • Backend: Ruby on Rails, Ruby, postgreSQL
  • Frontend: React, Typescript, GraphQL, HTML, CSS, Javascript frameworks
  • DevOps: AWS, Heroku
  • Monitoring tools: Sentry, Datadog
  • CI/CD experience: Buildkite

We don't need you to be experienced in all of these technologies but some exposure would be desirable.

The interview process

If you are interested in this opportunity, please hit APPLY and send us through your details. We'll be back in touch with you promptly.¬†

Should we proceed further you can expect 4 rounds of interviews:

  • Round 1: 30 min Zoom interview for us to get to know each other
  • Round 2: 60 min Zoom interview diving into your technical and leadership experiences
  • Round 3: 90 min Zoom interview where you'll complete a practical exercise with some of our team members
  • Round 4: 60 min interview with our CTO

In a hurry? We can speed this process up if needed - just let us know!

When you join Covidence you are joining a team that cares deeply for what we can build and achieve together. If you are ready to be more than just a cog in the machine; if you are smart, curious, want to create change, and are not scared of getting your hands dirty to make it happen ‚Äì then this is the place for you.

¬†

results.title: Lead Android Developer
results.description:
¬†

Waracle is home to a diverse and inclusive community of technologists.

We collaborate with ambitious businesses on their most challenging technology and digital product missions. In your career at Waracle you can expect to work on a variety of projects within some of the UK‚Äôs biggest brands in Health Tech, Fintech or Clean Tech, gaining experience and exposure to a range of languages and technologies.

Our growth has been significant and sustained, recently recognised by Clutch as one of the Top B2B companies in the UK, we are constantly seeking top industry talent to join our team and grow our expertise.

¬†

Waracle adopt a remote first ethos and provide a set up allowance you can use towards a comfy chair or desk! We have office space available in Dundee, Edinburgh, Glasgow and London if you miss that buzz in the office.

‚Äã‚ÄãThis position will offer a remote working pattern with some office presence at the London office (Once a month) and is open to both permanent and contract candidates.



Waracle are looking for a Lead Android Developer to join our ambitious team. You must have extensive knowledge of mobile platforms, preferably Android, Kotlin, Java.

As an experienced Lead Android Developer you should have technical / team leadership experience.

You‚Äôll relish the challenge of having to solve complex problems and come up with brilliant solutions and products. You‚Äôll be a strong communicator and able to get ideas across to the team and also be able to build strong relationships with the business and corporate stakeholders.

¬†

¬†

  • Experience developing Android apps using Kotlin and Java using different Android API versions

  • Experience with third-party libraries, API and open-source Android ecosystem

  • Working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies

  • Experience in leading software development within teams of mixed experience

  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning

  • Extensive experience with practice libraries - Hilt, Dagger2, RxJava, Coroutines, Retrofit

  • Some basic level of intel/understanding of JavaScript and React.js

  • Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle

  • Experience working within financial services or other regulated environments is preferred

¬†

Research shows that underrepresented groups tend to only apply when they tick every box. So if you think you have the skills, but don't meet every single bullet point above, please still apply. We'd love to have a chat with you.

The recruitment process you can expect for this role is an initial call with your dedicated Talent Acquisition Partner who will chat with you about Waracle, what you are looking for in a new position, the salary for the role, notice period and benefits (the important stuff!). After that, will follow a technical test then an interview, where you have an opportunity to showcase your technical craft, find out more about the role and show off your skills and experience. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will guide you through the whole process to your first day with us.

¬†

¬†

We love to have fun, make friends for life and spend time together outside of work! We have various events, days out, competitions and incentives throughout the year and here are some other benefits you can expect at Waracle.

¬†

üè° Flexible working and a remote-first ethos

üèñ Holidays ‚Äì 31 days per year and a day off on your birthday.

‚è∞ 35 hour working week

üí∏ Company Pension and personal financial advisor

üìà Free access to 1000s of personal development courses

üè• Group Life cover and Medicash Cash Plan

üçº Enhanced maternity and paternity leave

üçé Macbook and home office set up budget

Plus much more!

¬†

results.title: Software Engineer
results.description:
We are currently looking for a Software Engineer (primarily focused on backend development) to join the fast-growing product team at Flocknote. It's an important role in our company and will help shape the path forward for Flocknote.

We're a small, startup dev team with a passion for the Church and making great things. We work hard, have fun, and are always improving. Because we're a small shop, you must be self-motivated, able to manage your day-to-day schedule, and a very good communicator. You'll have the opportunity to have your hands in everything, from the data model to stylesheets, from concepts to launches, from process to implementation.

If you have a passion to help the Church, and enjoy dreaming up smart ways to solve problems and then watching your code come to life to make a real difference in the world, keep reading.

YOU'LL BE:

  • Managing technical aspects of the Flocknote service, including maintaining the health, uptime and performance of all Flocknote servers.
  • Continuing to build out Flocknote's robust backend, including queueing & messaging systems, user management & security, data archiving, email reputation & sending, and more.
  • Integrating with multiple 3rd party services, including billing, credit card processing, short (and long) code text messaging, phone calling, - Amazon SES, Amazon S3, Facebook, Twitter and others.
  • Implementing and developing new features across all areas of the stack.
  • Exterminating bugs and helping our support team make sure our customers have a great experience with Flocknote.

YOU'LL NEED:

  • To know your way around a LAMP stack or node servers.
  • To enjoy HTML, CSS, and vanilla Javascript.
  • Experience with OOP concepts and PHP (8+) framework-based development or extensive Node.js backend development experience.
  • Experience maintaining Linux VPS servers running Apache, PHP, and MySQL.
  • A strong knowledge of security best practices, especially as it relates to websites, including understanding of CSRF, XSS, encryption, SQL injection, etc.
  • The ability to learn quickly, multitask, and work independently in a fast-moving and dynamic environment.
  • To be a self-starter and a go-getter.
  • To have strong interpersonal skills and be flexible, detail-oriented, professional, easy to get along with, enthusiastic and of high moral character.

BONUS POINTS

  • Experience developing cross-client email design and understanding differences in HTML layout and compatibility issues for various email clients.
  • Experience with serverless architecture.
  • Experience with PCI & other data security compliance.
  • Ability to debug performance issues using XHProf, viewing log files, and using MySQL's EXPLAIN queries.
  • Experience with AWS.
  • Knowledge of Elasticsearch and other NoSQL datastores.

All positions are full-time (remote/work-from-home) positions with salary and benefits.

results.title: Back End Software Developer
results.description:
Optimile is an international software as a service (SaaS) company, providing a range of applications in the field of mobility. Optimile has developed a cloud based platform that takes a Charging as a Service (CaaS) and Mobility as a Service (MaaS) approach in order to connect users with various means of transport.
Optimile offers a white label charge point operator (CPO) and mobility service provider (MSP) platform for electric vehicles and charging infrastructure to professional customers worldwide. Optimile is based in Ghent, Belgium. We operate in seven countries across 213.000 charging points, of which 11.000 with our own label. The shareholders of Optimile are BNP Paribas Fortis, Touring and AG Insurance.

Our platform creates a connection between different mobility services and users, and is responsible for managing various charging points for electric vehicles. Through the linked app, transport information and budgeting is easily accessible to the users. To support our fast growth, we are looking for a remote Back End Software Developer to strengthen our development team.

Your role

  • You will work on our new, ecologically responsible form of networked mobility, building and improving the backbone of our platform.
  • You'll link and integrate services in the back office system (Python and Django) and be responsible for documenting and writing automated tests.
  • You'll be contributing to the further development of our change point management system for electrical vehicles and the integration of various mobility platforms.
  • You'll set up roaming connections with other charging station operators.
  • You'll set up interoperability with charging stations of other manufacturers.
  • You'll offer technical support in the backend system for problems with the charging stations.
  • Participate in the team process, using Agile Scrum methodologies to adapt and continuously improve.

Requirements

  • You are a backend developer living and working in the EU
  • You are willing to travel to our headquarters in Belgium once in a while
  • You have a Bachelor or Master degree, or have equal knowledge and skill by means of experience
  • You are fluent in English
  • You are interested in developing and expanding back-end systems
  • You are not afraid of a challenge and to learn new technologies
  • You have plenty experience working with Python and Django
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus

Benefits

  • Full-time permanent role, based remotely.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Fast growing international company.
  • A great, supportive team to work with.
  • The possibility to develop an innovative product in a new market within an international context

results.title: Front End Vue
results.description:
We are actively looking for Front End Developer (Vue) to join our client's international product company with exciting brand that is increasingly recognized across the world. This entertainment platform is represented in 4 continents and more than 10 countries.

Skills required:

‚Ä¢ At least 2 years of experience in front-end development;
‚Ä¢ Experience in front-end development targeting desktop;
‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of JavaScript Core, ES6+, HTML5, CSS3, post-processors;
‚Ä¢ Vue/Vuex/Vue ecosystem knowledge and experience;
‚Ä¢ Experience with real-time¬†data¬†processing and asynchronous programming model;
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in tests creation;
‚Ä¢ Experience with WebSockets, Git, Docker, Nginx.

Desirable skills and personal features:

‚Ä¢ Experience in applying multi-branding concepts for a single cross-platform product;
‚Ä¢ Experience in Immutable, Lodash, Storybook, CSS Modules, SCSS
‚Ä¢ Experience with GitLab, JIRA, Confluence;
‚Ä¢ CI/CD processes implementation, experience with ‚Ä¢ TDD/BDD and test automation;
‚Ä¢ Experience in performance optimization;
‚Ä¢ Experience with Webpack, NPM.

We invite those who fired up to:

‚Ä¢ Developing a user interface and logic for a complex SPA;
‚Ä¢ Working with full developing cycle (from accepting technical requirements from BA/SA, code reviewing ‚Äì to delivering changes to production);
‚Ä¢ Teamwork in the context of CI/CD and everything related to it (short-lived branches, code review, following code conventions, feature toggles, etc);
‚Ä¢ Closely communicating with designers, BA's, and product managers, provide the best solutions and influence the product design.

We‚ÄØoffer:

‚Ä¢ Medical insurance/Sport compensation;
‚Ä¢ Sport club participation (football, running, basketball or swimming clubs);
‚Ä¢ 100% paid sick leaves;
‚Ä¢ 20 working days of paid vacation.
‚Ä¢ Bonuses according to company's policy;
‚Ä¢ Gifts for significant life events (marriage, childbirth).
‚Ä¢ Individual annual training budget with an opportunity to visit paid conferences, training sessions, workshops etc.;
‚Ä¢ Free corporate library;
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to visit our non-stop internal meetups: open talks, IT Pump, etc. as a participant or a speaker and exchange knowledge;
‚Ä¢ Corporate parties and events (Pub Quiz, Carquest, etc.).

results.title: NetSuite Administrator
results.description:
Come join an amazing team! Kindred Bravely is looking for a talented and experienced NetSuite Administrator who wants to work from home and help us make HER day.

¬†

Kindred Bravely is an online retailer for pregnant and breastfeeding moms who want something comfortable to wear. We are a growing team of over 60+ people based all over the world. Our team culture is grateful, brave, generous, encouraging, confident, and transparent. We work together to create the best product and shopping experience possible for our customers. Oh, and did we mention we're on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing privately held companies four years in a row? We won Shopify's Build a BIGGER Business Competition and our award-winning product has been featured in Self Magazine, What to Expect, Ovia, BabyCenter, and Romper

Opportunity (the job):¬†

The NetSuite Administrator is responsible for supporting the team's NetSuite and other assigned systems needs by responding to technical questions, search queries, and minor development needs. You will be the team's main point of contact for NetSuite and NetSuite connected systems support before it gets escalated to a senior NetSuite consultant or developer.

Schedule:¬†Full-time: Hours are flexible, but must overlap at least 4 hours per day with our normal business hours (Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm Pacific Time)

¬†

Location:¬†USA - Remote

Experience:¬† Has a minimum of¬†2-3 years of experience as a NetSuite admin and 1 year experience with Celigo.

Salary:¬†Commensurate with Experience

We aim to out care the marketplace by offering:

  • Employer-sponsored medical, dental, vision as well as voluntary benefits (Life Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance).
  • Free mental health services.
  • Retirement and charitable donation matching.
  • Paid parental leave program and tuition assistance program after 1 year.
  • $50 reimbursement per month to spend on a "Random Act of Generosity".
  • 40% off product discounts on the Kindred Bravely, Davy Piper, and Sensible, 15% off for friends and family.
  • Amazing team culture, surprise perks throughout the year, and a really fun place to work!

We are looking for someone who...

  • Has 2-3 years' admin experience in NetSuite One World Apparel environments
  • Has at least 1 year' experience using Celigo
  • Knows how to read and write NetSuite scripts and workflows
  • Knows how to create Suite Analytics
  • Is detail oriented with good follow through skills
  • Has strong analytical and planning skills
  • Has good communication and presentation skills
  • Has excellent problem-solving skills and a positive, can-do attitude
  • Is willing to learn a wide range of systems and technologies
  • Has enthusiasm to hone troubleshooting/analyzing problems while working with team members to solve their issues
  • Is calm under pressure and able to adjust daily tasks based on changing priorities

¬†

Responsibilities Include (But are not limited to):

¬†

  • Oversee NetSuite and Celigo integration¬† issues and ensure effective long-term problem resolution
  • Oversee and produce workflows, SuiteScript deployments, bundles, Suiteanalytics and other custom NetSuite features
  • Design and revise our configuration of NetSuite as needed to meet the needs of the business including the creation of fields, workflow rules, custom reports, dashboards, and KPI's, etc.
  • Resolve system issues and administer user accounts and permissions
  • Provide NetSuite training and support to all users and departments as needed
  • Customize forms, reduce duplicate and unnecessary fields to enhance ease of use
  • Manage existing NetSuite integrations (direct integrations or via Celigo) , including but not limited to: Celigo, ShipStation, Shopify, Amazon, Shiphero, Narvar, Veem, Expensify and RF-Smart
  • Develop, configure, test and troubleshoot new integrations
  • Respond to team inquiries and problem solve in a professional and effective fashion
  • Reply via Slack and Email to team members (during working hours) within 1 hour on urgent NetSuite items
  • Provide feedback to the company regarding recommended features and enhancements
  • Proactively improve our instance of NetSuite and team usage
  • Attend weekly scheduled meetings
  • Perform other related duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Possess strong technical skills and can assist with NetSuite custom scripts (SuiteScript and JavaScript experience)
  • Candidate must have a proven track record of contributing to technical support
  • Skilled in data analytics and running NetSuite's reports and saved searches
  • Act as a main point of contact for NetSuite core and integrations functionality
  • Experience in design, development, and optimization of reports via SQL functions
  • Knowledgeable in Excel Macro, VBA, Advanced Excel, data science and data analytics
  • Experience in NetSuite Administration (installation, configuration, maintenance (manipulation), performance tuning) and managing Celigo to NetSuite integrations
  • Extensive knowledge and experience with NetSuite

If you've made it this far and you are as excited as we are, keep reading!

What we believe:

¬†

¬†

¬†

  • She is the reason we exist: We have created a genuine connection with her. She feels seen and heard. She is an integral part of every decision we make. We are her.
  • Work/Life Balance is an imperative: We value both work and family and bring our best selves to each by ensuring balance.
  • Success is Sequential; Not Simultaneous: We focus on one thing at a time.

How we act:

  • Team Work Makes the Dream Work: We share ideas, feedback, struggles, wins and frustrations. We care for each other professionally and personally.
  • We have a Bias for Action: We move quickly. We take smart risks. We solve puzzles. We make things happen.
  • We Hold Ourselves Accountable: We all own the business. We clearly communicate key metrics and standards and review them regularly. We analyze results to understand why we made a decision. We are disciplined.
  • We Lead, Not Follow: We are innovative. We are curious and resourceful. We are driven and competitive (but not with each other).
  • We Communicate Genuinely and Transparently: With each other and with her. We are present.
  • We are Always Learning: We improve ourselves and continually look for ways to enhance the skills and abilities of our entire team.
  • We are in Relentless Pursuit of Customer Service Excellence: We out-care the competition and provide the greatest experience she has ever had with a brand.

We Hire the Best, Regardless of Their Location:

Unlike other jobs, we don't believe that what you do should dictate whether you get to spend time with family or not.¬†

We're looking for people who can demonstrate they hold themselves to a higher standard in everything they do, because with great flexibility comes great responsibility.

All this flexibility doesn't mean we're not a close-knit team‚Ä¶

We Hire Characters Not Positions:

We're a small company with big aspirations, and we work hard (and have a LOT of fun) while making that happen. If you have what it takes as an individual - in other words, if you're a consistent high-achiever in everything you do in life - then you'll fit in well at our company.

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

results.title: iOS Engineer
results.description:
To help keep everyone safe, we encourage all applicants to pay close attention to protect themselves during their job search. When applying for a position online you are at risk of being targeted by malicious actors looking for personal data. Please be aware we will only reach out via email using the domain BlueOwl.xyz or HiRoad.com. Anything that does not match those domains should be ignored and considered a security risk.
¬†
Our Mission
¬†
We make good things happen by recognizing and rewarding people for taking the high road. How? By reinventing insurance that celebrates people‚Äôs mindful choices.
¬†
Insurance was fundamentally a brilliant idea, but it always had a key challenge ‚Äî it couldn‚Äôt identify and acknowledge the positive decisions that individuals made along the way. But when we apply smart mobile technologies, we can. And that‚Äôs what we do. We help our customers save on their monthly bill. But more importantly, they join a growing movement of people who dare to live more mindfully because doing so is simply better for everyone.
¬†
We‚Äôre a well-funded, talent dense team of people who care about using our skills to do good. From data science, to design, engineering, insurance, product, research, user experience and beyond ‚Äî we believe in people who believe they can make the world even better. Join us, and let‚Äôs build the higher path that is HiRoad.

The Role

We‚Äôre looking for an accomplished and well-rounded iOS Engineer to help build and enhance our mobile applications. Responsibilities include architecting solutions to solve our complex problems, developing new and innovative experiences within our iOS applications, and providing clear estimation and scope of development to format clear roadmaps. You‚Äôll analyze and optimize applications for quality, efficiency, and performance and collaborate cross functionally within the organization on key projects.

Your day-to-day

  • Developing features to improve experiences on iOS applications
  • Collaborating closely with engineering, product and design teams on projects
  • Refactoring code base to improve efficiency, reliability, and scalability
  • Improving knowledge and experience on mobile development practices and strategies

About you

  • Team Player. You enjoy discussing solutions or bouncing ideas off of team members. Growing your knowledge and sharing it are something you enjoy in your work environment. You also enjoy experimenting and are enthusiastic about new tech.
  • You know how to test. You know your code may not be perfect but you have experience writing unit tests to help build confidence that what you write is stable. You also can describe what kind of automated tests can be used and how to apply them to complex components.
  • Architecture is key. You have an understanding of architecture patterns and are willing to learn more on why they are used and how to apply them to a variety of scenarios.
  • Threading and concurrency in UIKit using GCD and Operations in Swift are clear to you. You can clearly explain asynchronous options, understand how they run under the hood, and are able to choose the best option given the task. You never dead lock on race conditions.
  • You have a complete understanding of Apple‚Äôs recommended coding standards. Apple provided frameworks are all common knowledge to you and you have a preference for those libraries before utilizing third party ones. Bonus Points
  • Experience developing user interfaces to support multiple device sizes using Storyboards, Size Classes and Auto-Layout Constraints
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one of these frameworks: AVFoundation, MapKit, CoreLocation
  • Knowledge of the iOS SDK performance tools and optimization techniques
  • You have been involved in the release process of iOS applications through the App Store
